content.description:
Sit start with a pair of bumps and a left heel hook. From there, work along the lip to the jugs, gain a good right heel hook, crank up to the bump, mantel, and finish up the remaining slab (same finish as

Easy Livin'

and

Broken Odors

).
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing isn't good, because a rocks sits directly in the middle of it.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Roundabout.

content.description:
Trashcan Man ascends a featured overhang on decent rock over a very good landing.

Sit start with hands matched on a big flat edge and left foot heel-toe cam (same start as

Easy Livin'

). From there, stick a great left hand edge, follow with a right hand two-finger edge, then move both hands to a good crescent-shaped edge, set the feet, make a big move up to a great edge, match, and drop off.

I normally see the problem through on the top outs, but the upper section has at least one large, unconsolidated chunk of rock that could be pulled off. Traversing right for the finish would probably be more solid, but the real business lies in the problem I described above.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The immediate fall zone is great, but there a few rocks just behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Roundabout.

content.description:
Sit start with edges. From there, come out the slight overhang onto the slab, and finish up the edges to reach an easy mantel.

This problem also doubles as part of the boulder's downclimb.
content.protection: A pad will work. It has a perfect landing.
content.location: It climbs the east side of Roundabout's southeast arete.

content.description: Stand start with a decent left hand sidepull and palmed right hand. From there, work up through edges to reach a two-finger pocket below the lip and an eventual easy but lichen-filled topout.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect here.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Roundabout's north face.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of opposing sidepulls. From there, the left hand up the arete while using the right hand pockets on the face, eventually gain the horizontal seam, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Roundabout's northeast arete.

content.description: Stand start with pockets. From there, use the vertical seam to reach the horizontal seam, move slight right, reach the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing doesn't get any better.
content.location:
It climbs the north face of Roundabout, in between

Huckles For Home

and

Bob Dylan Fragrance Line

.

content.description: Sit start at a jug with a left foot, heel hook, foot cam action. You can really lock it in there. Go out with a right hand to a hold, lock off, and bring your left hand up to the horizontal crack. From there, traverse left and top out.

Sit start with hands matched on a large jug-fin that looks like it would snap in a heartbeat - but it's actually quite solid. From there, pull to the large shelf, traverse left using the seam, make a big diagonal move to the left, continue traversing, connect to

Easy Livin'

(same finish), and top it out.
content.protection: A pair pads will work fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It traverses the entire west face of Roundabout.

content.description:
Stand start with two small crimps about seven feet off the ground.  From there, work a right hand gaston (crux), match hands on the horizontal seam, make a move for the lip, and top it out.

There is a good down climb on the east face.
content.protection: A few pads, but the landing is perfect.
content.location: It is in the center of Roundabout's north face.

content.description: Sit start with edges. From there, come out the slight overhang to edges, and finish up the remaining slab to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. It has a perfect landing.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Roundabout's northeast arete.
